events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of April 30th involving their vehicle and another automobile.
The claim was reviewed and categorized as an auto accident due to the nature of the collision described in the report.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to facilitate communication and assistance throughout the claim process.
The insurer sent a confirmation to the claimant acknowledging receipt of the auto accident claim and outlining next steps.
Request was made for police reports, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to support the investigation.
The claimant provided all required documents including the official accident report and detailed vehicle damage images.
The claims department began a thorough investigation of the auto accident claim to verify all details and assess liability.
Investigation concluded confirming the claimant was not at fault and the damage assessment aligned with submitted documentation.
An initial settlement offer was proposed for the vehicle repairs and temporary rental car coverage during the repair period.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the promptness of the settlement proposal and clarity of the payment terms.
The claim was formally approved by the claims manager, authorizing payment for repairs as per the proposed settlement.
Payment was issued to the claimantâ€™s chosen repair shop, covering all approved costs related to the auto accident damage.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that repairs were completed and the claimant was fully compensated.
